00034 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00035 uint8_t menu[]=
00036         "*******************************************************************************\n\r"
00037         "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00038         "CAN Self-test demo \n\r"
00039         "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00040         "\t - Core: ARM CORTEX-M3 \n\r"
00041         "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200 bps \n\r"
00042         "Use only CAN1 peripherals to test\n\r"
00043         "This example used to test Self test mode\n\r"
00044         "*******************************************************************************\n\r";

00047 CAN_MSG_Type TXMsg, RXMsg; // messages for test Bypass mode
00048 uint32_t CANRxCount, CANTxCount = 0;

00058 
00059 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00060 /*********************************************************************/
00065 void CAN_IRQHandler()
00066 {
00067         uint8_t IntStatus;
00068 //      uint32_t data1;
00069         /* Get CAN status */
00070         IntStatus = CAN_GetCTRLStatus(LPC_CAN1, CANCTRL_STS);
00071         //check receive buffer status
00072         if((IntStatus>>0)&0x01)
00073         {
00074                 CAN_ReceiveMsg(LPC_CAN1,&RXMsg);
00075                 _DBG_("Received buffer:");
00076                 PrintMessage(&RXMsg);
00077                 //Validate received and transmited message
00078                 if(Check_Message(&TXMsg, &RXMsg))
00079                         _DBG_("Self test is SUCCESSFUL!!!");
00080                 else
00081                         _DBG_("Self test is FAIL!!!");
00082         }
00083 }
00084 
00085 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS----------------------------*/
00086 /*********************************************************************/
00091 void PrintMessage(CAN_MSG_Type* CAN_Msg)
00092 {
00093         uint32_t data;
00094         _DBG("Message ID:     ");
00095         _DBH32(CAN_Msg->id);_DBG_("");
00096         _DBG("Message length: ");
00097         _DBH32(CAN_Msg->len);_DBG_(" BYTES");
00098         _DBG("Message type:   ");
00099         if(CAN_Msg->type==DATA_FRAME)
00100         {
00101                 _DBG_("DATA FRAME ");
00102         }
00103         else
00104                 _DBG_("REMOTE FRAME ");
00105         _DBG("Message format: ");
00106         if(CAN_Msg->format==STD_ID_FORMAT)
00107         {
00108                 _DBG_("STANDARD ID FRAME FORMAT");
00109         }
00110         else
00111                 _DBG_("EXTENDED ID FRAME FORMAT");
00112         _DBG("Message dataA:  ");
00113         data = (CAN_Msg->dataA[0])|(CAN_Msg->dataA[1]<<8)|(CAN_Msg->dataA[2]<<16)|(CAN_Msg->dataA[3]<<24);
00114         _DBH32(data);_DBG_("");
00115         data = (CAN_Msg->dataB[0])|(CAN_Msg->dataB[1]<<8)|(CAN_Msg->dataB[2]<<16)|(CAN_Msg->dataB[3]<<24);
00116         _DBG("Message dataB:  ");
00117         _DBH32(data);_DBG_("");
00118         _DBG_("");
00119 }
00120 
00121 /*********************************************************************/
00126 void CAN_InitMessage(void) {
00127         TXMsg.format = EXT_ID_FORMAT;
00128         TXMsg.id = 0x00001234;
00129         TXMsg.len = 8;
00130         TXMsg.type = DATA_FRAME;
00131         TXMsg.dataA[0] = TXMsg.dataA[1] = TXMsg.dataA[2] = TXMsg.dataA[3] = 0x12;
00132         TXMsg.dataB[0] = TXMsg.dataB[1] = TXMsg.dataB[2] = TXMsg.dataB[3] = 0x34;
00133 
00134         RXMsg.format = 0x00;
00135         RXMsg.id = 0x00;
00136         RXMsg.len = 0x00;
00137         RXMsg.type = 0x00;
00138         RXMsg.dataA[0] = RXMsg.dataA[1] = RXMsg.dataA[2] = RXMsg.dataA[3] = 0x00000000;
00139         RXMsg.dataB[0] = RXMsg.dataA[1] = RXMsg.dataA[2] = RXMsg.dataA[3] = 0x00000000;
00140 }
00141 
00142 /*********************************************************************/
00147 void print_menu()
00148 {
00149         _DBG_(menu);
00150 }
00151 
00152 /*********************************************************************/
00160 Bool Check_Message(CAN_MSG_Type* TX_Msg, CAN_MSG_Type* RX_Msg)
00161 {
00162         uint8_t i;
00163         if((TXMsg.format != RXMsg.format)|(TXMsg.id != RXMsg.id)|(TXMsg.len != RXMsg.len)\
00164                 |(TXMsg.type != RXMsg.type))
00165                 return FALSE;
00166         for(i=0;i<4;i++)
00167         {
00168                 if((TXMsg.dataA[i]!=RXMsg.dataA[i])|(TXMsg.dataB[i]!=RXMsg.dataB[i]))
00169                         return FALSE;
00170         }
00171         return TRUE;
00172 }
00173 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00174 /*********************************************************************/
00179 int c_entry(void) { /* Main Program */
00180 
00181         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00182          * – 115200bps
00183          * – 8 data bit
00184          * – No parity
00185          * – 1 stop bit
00186          * – No flow control
00187          */
00188         debug_frmwrk_init();
00189         print_menu();
00190 
00191         /* Initialize CAN1 peripheral
00192          * Note: Self-test mode doesn't require pin selection
00193          */
00194         CAN_Init(LPC_CAN1, 125000);
00195 
00196         //Enable self-test mode
00197         CAN_ModeConfig(LPC_CAN1, CAN_SELFTEST_MODE, ENABLE);
00198 
00199         //Enable Interrupt
00200         CAN_IRQCmd(LPC_CAN1, CANINT_RIE, ENABLE);
00201         CAN_IRQCmd(LPC_CAN1, CANINT_TIE1, ENABLE);
00202 
00203         //Enable CAN Interrupt
00204         NVIC_EnableIRQ(CAN_IRQn);
00205         CAN_SetAFMode(LPC_CANAF,CAN_AccBP);
00206         CAN_InitMessage();
00207         _DBG_("Transmitted buffer:");
00208         PrintMessage(&TXMsg);
00209 
00213         CAN_SendMsg(LPC_CAN1, &TXMsg);
00214         LPC_CAN1->CMR |=(1<<4); //Self Reception Request
00215 
00216         while (1);
00217 }
00218 
00219 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00220  allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00221  heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00222  toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00223  file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00224 int main(void) {
00225         return c_entry();
00226 }
